newsitem.title: FRANCE: Paribas to transfer Belgian unit to Bacob.
newsitem.headline: Paribas to transfer Belgian unit to Bacob.

text.p: French financial holding company Paribas said on Friday it and Groupe Bacob-Arco had signed a memorandum laying out plans to transfer Paribas Belgique to Groupe Bacob-Arco.
"The memorandum envisages the sale by Groupe Paribas of 47 percent of Paribas Belgique to Groupe Bacob-Arco to add to its existing shareholding," Paribas said in a statement.
"At the same time, Groupe Bacob-Arco would launch a tender offer to minority shareholders which could increase its shareholding to 70 percent," it said.
"The remaining 30 percent of the shares would be kept by Paribas and could be sold to Bacob-Arco thereafter," says the statement.

The French group said its Belgian unit, mainly involved in commercial banking, held a "significant share of the domestic market", employing 1,400 staff with around 50 agencies and that it made a profit of four billion Belgian francs in 1996.
"Banque Bacob has a strong position in the Belgian retail banking market, notably in the non-profit making organisation, repo and securitisation sectors," said the statement.
Paribas said the deal would "allow a new leading Belgian bank entity to be created".
The statement did not give financial details of the transaction.
Banque Bacob, the most important subsidiary of the Bacob-Arco group, earned net income of 3.1 billion Belgian francs in 1996, the statement said, and it has 3,600 staff in 562 agencies.
